Judul: ECONOMIC VALUATION OF MINING PROJECT USING FUZZY REAL OPTION METHOD: CASE STUDY OF UNDERGROUND GOLD MINE
Abstrak: Mining is a risky business due to many uncertainties of geology, technic, economic, environment, and social aspects. For technical aspect, its uncertainty could be reduced by further or detail study. But for economic aspect, in this case commodity price, the uncertainty could be managed by adopting financial option theory. In financial option theory, mining project is evaluated using the concept of stock market which option holder has a right to choose whether they sell the option in strike price or wait and sell the option in the maturity time. Financial option theory combined with concept of furry logic called as fuzzy real option. This paper will apply fuzzy real option method for valuing underground gold mine project. Traditional discounted cash flow method applied for 11-month production period preceded by 18-month of development period produced negative Net Present Value (NPV). However, valuation using fuzzy real option method by considering 22 month of delay time will produce positive NPV.
